story:
Once upon a time, in the beautiful land of Ethiopia, there lived a young girl named Selam. Selam was a kind and curious girl who loved to explore the forests and mountains around her village. She had a special gift - she could communicate with the animals and plants of the land.

One evening, as the sun began to set and the stars twinkled in the sky, Selam sat under a large acacia tree in her village. The tree whispered to her, "Selam, my dear, I have a tale to tell you tonight."

Selam listened intently as the acacia tree began to tell a story about the magic of friendship. The tale was about a lion and a little bird who became unlikely friends. The lion, known for his courage and strength, found himself lost and lonely one day in the wilderness. The little bird, with its tiny wings and gentle song, offered to guide the lion back home.

As they journeyed together, facing many challenges along the way, the lion and the bird grew closer and learned to appreciate each other's unique strengths. The lion protected the bird from predators, while the bird showed the lion the beauty and wonder of the world around them.

In the end, the lion and the bird became inseparable friends, teaching everyone that friendship knows no boundaries and that true strength comes from understanding and compassion.

As the story came to an end, Selam looked up at the stars in wonder, feeling grateful for the lessons she had learned. The acacia tree whispered softly, "Remember, Selam, that kindness and friendship can light up even the darkest of nights."

With a heart full of warmth and love, Selam bid goodnight to the acacia tree and returned to her home, carrying the story of the lion and the bird in her heart.

And as she drifted off to sleep, the stars above seemed to sparkle just a little brighter, shining down on Selam with their everlasting love and light.

The end. Goodnight, sweet Selam.
